faqSection.title: Frequently Asked Questions About Buying a 3 BHK Flat in Sector 21B
faqSection.description: Get immediate answers to the most common queries regarding pricing, legal documents, and the lifestyle offered by 3 BHK flats in Sector 21B

faqs.question: What is the typical price range for a quality 3 BHK Flat For Sale in Sector 21B
faqs.answer: The pricing for a quality 3 BHK flat in Sector 21B can vary significantly based on the builder, the age of the property, the specific society amenities offered, and the size of the apartment, typically measured in super area. Generally, you can expect prices to start from approximately 95 lakhs and go upward to 175 lakhs or more for super-luxury residential complexes. Flats closer to the main commercial road or those with superior fixtures like VRV air conditioning tend to command premium pricing. We recommend scheduling a consultation to receive a precise valuation based on your specific requirements and budget constraints.

faqs.question: Are the properties in Sector 21B freehold or leasehold
faqs.answer: Most residential properties and apartments developed by private builders in Sector 21B are sold on a freehold basis, meaning the buyer receives permanent ownership rights to the property and the undivided share of land. However, it is absolutely crucial to review the allotment letter and the sale deed of the specific 3 BHK flat you are interested in. Our legal advisors meticulously check all documentation to confirm the nature of the title and ensure that the transfer of ownership is legally sound and without encumbrances before you proceed with the transaction.

faqs.question: What are the common maintenance charges for a 3 BHK apartment in this sector
faqs.answer: Maintenance charges in Sector 21B housing societies cover essential services like common area electricity, water supply management, 24/7 security services, gardening, housekeeping of common spaces, and access to the clubhouse and gym facilities. These charges are usually calculated based on the Super Built-Up Area of your 3 BHK flat and typically range between Rs 3.50 to Rs 5.50 per square foot per month. Always confirm the exact calculation and what services are included during the initial discussion with the society management.

faqs.question: Can Non-Resident Indians NRI purchase property in Sector 21B
faqs.answer: Absolutely. Non-Resident Indians NRI are permitted to purchase both residential and commercial real estate in India, including 3 BHK flats in Sector 21B, subject to compliance with FEMA regulations. NRIs must complete transactions using authorized banking channels like NRE or NRO accounts. Our specialized NRI desk can guide you through the regulatory requirements, documentation process, and repatriation rules to ensure a smooth and legal purchase experience.

faqs.question: What essential documents should I verify before finalizing the purchase of a 3 BHK flat
faqs.answer: Before finalizing the purchase of any 3 BHK flat in Sector 21B, you must verify the following essential documents the Occupancy Certificate OC, the Completion Certificate CC, the registered Sale Deed, the building plan approval from the relevant authority, and proof of RERA registration for the project. For resale properties, you must also examine the chain of title deeds and ensure there are no existing mortgages or liens on the property. Never skip a thorough legal due diligence review.
